page.title: 13ABBERTON RESERVOIR BIRDLIFE
page.content: Abberton reservoir is one of the best sanctuaries in the British Isles for a large number of waterfowl, waders and seabirds as well as local country birds. The reservoir itself is extremely rich in food and fish and can support a large bird population. It is located within 4 kilometres of the estuary of the River Blackwater, where some species go to fish. There are various ducks present including: Mallard, Teal, Wigeon, Gadwall, Tufted, Pochard, Golden Eye and Shoveler. Birds of prey that have visited include: Peregrine Falcon, Kestrel, Marsh Harrier, Sparrow Hawk and Osprey. The Cormorant is breeding successfully at Abberton. Altogether 128 different species have been spotted since 1970.
